===Etymology 1===
<div style="float:right;">
{{wikipedia|lang=ja|ナシ}}
{{wikipedia|Pyrus pyrifolia}}
[[File:Pear-tree,katori-city,japan.JPG|thumb|250px|{{lang|ja|梨}} (''nashi'', ''ri'', ''rin'': the {{l|en|tree}} and the {{l|en|fruit}}.]]
</div>
{{ja-kanjitab|なし|yomi=kun}}
From {{etyl|ojp|ja|sort=なし}}. Derivation unclear, with numerous theories. Two of the more common are given below.

* May be originally a compound of {{compound|lang=ja|sort=なし|中|tr1=na</i>, hypothesized root of modern <i>naka|t1=middle, center|白|tr2=shiro|t2=white}} in reference to the pale flesh of the fruit.

: {{IPAchar|*/na ɕiro/}} → {{IPAchar|/naɕi/}}

* Alternatively, may be originally a compound of {{compound|lang=ja|sort=なし|中|tr1=na</i>, hypothesized root of modern <i>naka|t1=middle, center|酢|tr2=su|t2=sour, acidic}} in reference to the way the flavor of the fruit becomes more astringent closer to the core.

: {{IPAchar|*/na su/}} → {{IPAchar|/naɕi/}}
